item.title: Zach add a quote by Leonard Cohen
item.description: "I don't remember lighting this cigarette and I don't remember if I'm here alone or waiting for someone." -- Leonard Cohen

item.title: Zach add a quote by Raymond Carver
item.description: "Booze takes a lot of time and effort if you're going to do a good job with it." -- Raymond Carver

item.title: Zach add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "I'm a kind of paranoiac in reverse. I suspect people of plotting to make me happy." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Zach add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "An artist's only concern is to shoot for some kind of perfection, and on his own terms, not anyone else's." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Zach add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "when you're not looking, somebody'll sneak up and write "Fuck you" right under your nose." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Zach add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "He had a theory, Walt did, that the religious life, and all the agony that goes with it, is just something God sicks on people who have the gall to accuse him of having created an ugly world." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Zach add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "Did you know, God damn it, that Les was all for bringing a tangerine in to you last night before he went to bed? My God. Even Bessie can't stand stories with tangerines in them. And God knows I can't. If you're going to go on with this breakdown business, I wish to hell you'd go back to college to have it. Where you're not the baby of the family. And where, God knows, nobody'll have any urges to bring you any tangerines. And where you don't keep your goddam tap shoes in the closet." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Zach add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "I privately say to you, old friend... please accept from me this unpretentious bouquet of early-blooming parentheses: (((())))." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Zach add a quote by Jean-Paul Sartre
item.description: "All that I know about my life, it seems, I have learned in books." -- Jean-Paul Sartre

item.title: Zach add a quote by Jean-Paul Sartre
item.description: "Man is condemned to be free; because once thrown into the world, he is responsible for everything he does. It is up to you to give [life] a meaning." -- Jean-Paul Sartre

item.title: Zach add a quote by Jean Paul Sarte
item.description: "Like all dreamers I confuse disenchantment with truth." -- Jean Paul Sarte

item.title: Zach add a quote by Jean-Paul Sartre
item.description: "That God does not exist, I cannot deny, That my whole being cries out for God I cannot forget." -- Jean-Paul Sartre

item.title: Zach add a quote by Jean-Paul Sartre
item.description: "Consciousness is a being the nature of which is to be conscious of the nothingness of its being." -- Jean-Paul Sartre

item.title: Zach add a quote by Jose Saramago / ژوزه ساراماگو
item.description: ". . . if there is a way for the world to be transformed for the better, it can only be done by pessimism; optimists will never change the world for the better. " -- Jose Saramago / ژوزه ساراماگو

item.title: Zach add a quote by Baruch de Spinoza
item.description: "In so far as the mind sees things in their eternal aspect, it participates in eternity." -- Baruch de Spinoza

item.title: Zach add a quote by Baruch de Spinoza
item.description: "The supreme mystery of despotism, its prop and stay, is to keep men in a state of deception, and with the specious title of religion to cloak the fear by which they must be held in check, so that they will fight for their servitude as if for salvation." -- Baruch de Spinoza

item.title: Zach add a quote by Baruch De Spinoza
item.description: "Those who wish to seek out the cause of miracles and to understand the things of nature as philosophers, and not to stare at them in astonishment like fools, are soon considered heretical and impious, and proclaimed as such by those whom the mob adores as the interpreters of nature and the gods. For these men know that, once ignorance is put aside, that wonderment would be taken away, which is the only means by which their authority is preserved." -- Baruch De Spinoza

item.title: Zach add a quote by Spinoza
item.description: "No matter how thin you slice it, there will always be two sides." -- Spinoza

item.title: Zach add a quote by Baruch Spinoza
item.description: "Pride is pleasure arising from a man's thinking too highly of himself." -- Baruch Spinoza

item.title: Zach add a quote by Baruch Spinoza
item.description: "I have striven not to laugh at human actions, not to weep at them, nor to hate them, but to understand them." -- Baruch Spinoza
